task:
Create a Wordpress CMS Export Flatfile Listener plugin:
      - Implement a custom action to export data to Wordpress
      - Allow users to select the target CMS platform and provide necessary API credentials
      - Map Flatfile fields to corresponding CMS fields (e.g., title, content, author, categories, tags)
      - Support exporting rich text content, including formatting and embedded media
      - Implement options for post status (draft, published) and scheduling
      - Handle batch processing for efficient export of multiple posts
      - Provide error handling and reporting for failed exports
      - Allow configuration of default post settings (e.g., featured image, excerpt)
      - Implement a preview function to review post formatting before export
      - Support updating existing posts by matching on a unique identifier
      - Include options for handling custom fields specific to each CMS platform
summary: This code implements a Flatfile Listener that uses the Record Hook plugin to process records and export them to WordPress. It includes functionality for field mapping, handling custom fields, and updating existing posts.
steps: Retrieve general knowledge about Flatfile Listeners and the Record Hook plugin to understand the structure and capabilities we can utilize.
